javadoc: PartitionCodeSubIterator is an implementation of CodeBlockIterator capable of iterating in the forward direction over "PartitionCodeSubModel code blocks".

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new iterator that will iterate over the entire
 program starting from its current minimum address.

params.name: model
params.comment: the BlockModel the iterator will use in its operations.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new iterator that will iterate over the
 program starting from a given address.

params.name: model
params.comment: the BlockModel the iterator will use in its operations.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to start iterating from.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new iterator that will iterate over the
 program within a given address range set. A block will
 be returned by this iterator if and only if the block's
 starting address is within the address range set.  The blocks
 themselves may lie outside of set.

params.name: model
params.comment: the SubroutineModel the iterator will use in its operations.

params.name: set
params.comment:
the address range set which the iterator is to be
               restricted to.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

name: PartitionCodeSubIterator
comment:
PartitionCodeSubIterator is an implementation of
 CodeBlockIterator capable of iterating in
 the forward direction over "PartitionCodeSubModel code blocks".
